meanings.definition: Providing necessary support to the primary activities or operation.
meanings.sent1: The ancillary equipment helped the main machine work better.
meanings.sent2: The extra tools were ancillary to completing the project.
meanings.sent3: The sidekick's role was ancillary but crucial to the hero's success.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an ancillary light brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The safety net acted as an ancillary protector during the performance.

meanings.sent1: The ancillary characters added depth to the story.
meanings.sent2: The bonus features on the DVD were ancillary to the movie itself.
meanings.sent3: The extra toppings on the pizza were an ancillary delight.
meanings.sent4: His role in the project was like an ancillary puzzle piece fitting perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The decorations were ancillary elements that enhanced the party atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that provides support or assistance.
meanings.sent1: She was an ancillary to the team, always ready to help.
meanings.sent2: The tool served as an ancillary for the mechanic.
meanings.sent3: The sidekick in the movie was a humorous ancillary character.
meanings.sent4: The mentor acted as an ancillary guide in his career.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight became an ancillary when the power went out.
